intro: Stickmannia glaziovii, commonly known as the Glaziov's stickman, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its unique, elongated leaves and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments. Due to its striking appearance, it is occasionally cultivated as an ornamental plant.
